content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for the course 'Exploring Quantum Physics' on Coursera, offered by the University of Maryland, College Park. Identify the percentage (rounded) of 5-star ratings in the reviews.  Please interact with https://www.coursera.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page is an advertisement for Coursera Plus. There's no search box or menu visible to look for courses. I need to scroll down to find the site navigation or search functionality.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.0
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section showcases partner universities and the benefits of Coursera. There is still no visible search box or navigation menu to search for courses. I should keep scrolling down to find the search feature.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.0
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows featured courses and a "Show 8 more" button, but no search bar or broad navigation yet. I need a search function to look for the specific course, so continuing to scroll is necessary.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.0
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is now a visible search bar where I can enter a course name by keyword. This is the appropriate place to type "Exploring Quantum Physics" to find the course.
Action: Type 2; Exploring Quantum Physics
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search has returned the correct course "Exploring Quantum Physics" offered by University of Maryland, College Park. I need to view the detailed course page to analyze the reviews and find the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 10
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible again, but it appears I did not progress to the detailed course page. I should click on the course listing (element 11) to view details, specifically reviews and star breakdown.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The detailed course page for "Exploring Quantum Physics" has not yet loaded. I still need to click on the course listing (element 11) to access more detailed information, particularly about ratings and review breakdowns.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view has not changed and still shows the search results page with the course listing. To access the details page with reviews and star rating breakdown, I need to click on the course result (element 11).
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results page is still being displayed and I have not yet navigated to the detailed course page. I need to click on the course result (element 11) to view more details, especially the reviews breakdown necessary for answering the percentage of 5-star ratings.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results page is still displayed, and the listing for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is present but not yet selected. To access the needed ratings breakdown, I must click the course listing.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" is still listed in the search results, but the detailed page with the review breakdown has not been accessed. I must click on the course listing at element 11 to move forward.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" is visible but the detail page is not opened. To find the percentage of 5-star ratings in the reviews, I need the detailed course page, which requires clicking on the course entry.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The list of search results is visible and the correct course appears in element 11. I still need to access the course detail page to find the 5-star ratings breakdown. Clicking on element 11 is the necessary next step.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The course "Exploring Quantum Physics" by University of Maryland, College Park is clearly listed in search results (element 11), but the reviews and 5-star rating breakdown are not visible. Accessing the detailed course page is necessary to find the required review statistics.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Exploring Quantum Physics" course by University of Maryland, College Park continues to display only in the search results (element 11), without detailed information on the review breakdown. To access the 5-star ratings percentage, I must enter the course details by clicking on element 11.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results page is still displayed with "Exploring Quantum Physics" by University of Maryland, College Park (element 11), but there are no review details or breakdowns visible yet. To retrieve the percentage of 5-star ratings, I must enter the detailed course page.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search result for "Exploring Quantum Physics" from the University of Maryland, College Park is visible in element 11, but this is still just the search listing with an overall rating (4.2/5 from 70 reviews), not the detailed review breakdown needed to answer the task. The next step must be to access the detailed course view.
Action: Click 11
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Save now";	[2]: <input> "Search by keyword";	[3]: <button> "Clear search";	[4]: <button> "Search";	[5]: <button> "Business", "domainName, add to search";	[6]: <button> "Computer Science", "domainName, add to search";	[7]: <button> "Data Science", "domainName, add to search";	[8]: <button> "Health", "domainName, add to search";	[9]: <button> "Information Technology", "domainName, add to search";	[10]: <button> "Arts and Humanities", "domainName, add to search";	[11]: "Exploring Quantum PhysicsUniversity of Maryland, College ParkCourseFilled StarFilled StarFilled StarFilled StarStarRated 4.2 out of five stars. 70 reviews4.2(70)Mixed LevelMixed", "Exploring Quantum Physics";
